Articles.Content:
Seeing my achievements right now, I think I should write a proper review about the last version of the overhaul... A lot of my first impressions are wrong.

Btw, I don't know how I do it (I'm searching the concrete change ) but seems that I have auroras working on dark side (of course not when PlanetShine do his work right, then the black is back).

Can you post the config?

I just copied Kerbin in the normal config and added in Laythe, Blalo, and Etaria in.

So... ahhh... this happens:

Whenever I put my custom clouds.cfg into the game, it takes a while to load from the main menu and then this happens. It is the space centre screen, or is supposed to be

So... ahhh... this happens:

Whenever I put my custom clouds.cfg into the game, it takes a while to load from the main menu and then this happens. It is the space centre screen, or is supposed to be

http://i.imgur.com/wgx4l20.png

There are some type of error, somewhere, in your EVE's .cfg files.
Chez, are you using cam values in your config? Looks like an incorrect cam clipping plane value

There are some type of error, somewhere, in your EVE's .cfg files.

Yep, somewhere there was an error. Everything looked alright though so I'm pretty baffled.

Chez, are you using cam values in your config? Looks like an incorrect cam clipping plane value

I don't think so? It just re-did the config and things are back to normal, which is good. This latest version is pretty buggy though. I'm getting some pretty weird atmosphere issues.

Yep, somewhere there was an error. Everything looked alright though so I'm pretty baffled.

I don't think so? It just re-did the config and things are back to normal, which is good. This latest version is pretty buggy though. I'm getting some pretty weird atmosphere issues.

I had that type of errors usually and I think as you before, but is not buggy, it's just high sensitive with typo mistakes. An extra comma, or a point in a wrong place when you are changing values, can turn all down.

The atmos needs to be reworked (turns wrong to darkness and so on) as Rbray said some pages ago.
must...resist...
This is probably a stupid question, but what's the difference between this and regular EVE?

This is probably a stupid question, but what's the difference between this and regular EVE?

This is the thread about the development of the new version of EVE. The difference and the topic, in some way, is how this version does the old things, and how does a lot of new things.

This is probably a stupid question, but what's the difference between this and regular EVE?

This is a tad more unstable, but has so many more features that aren't present with 7-4. From a player perspective, the only major changes in this download are atmospheric haze, a new cloud layer, new city lights and daytime cities.

This is the thread about the development of the new version of EVE. The difference and the topic, in some way, is how this version does the old things, and how does a lot of new things.

What sort of new things? I noticed atmospheric scattering.
rbray, are there any plans on allowing us to put cloud layers over the sun? I'm trying to make the stock sun look a little nicer
Does anyone know why when "shadow = False" then the layer is turned off? Not just the shadow.

Does anyone know why when "shadow = False" then the layer is turned off? Not just the shadow.

Seems like a temporal bug.

Does anyone know why when "shadow = False" then the layer is turned off? Not just the shadow.

Having the same issue. Doesn't sound like much of a pain, but it is.

Rbray I've been thinking, whist trying out the new SpaceEngine which employs CubeMaps for all of its solar system textures, how conceivable it might be to have cube map projection for cloud layers? I'd allow >8k overall textures on planets (which I know might be way to much for x32 currently).

I dunno just a thought

rbray, we miss you ._.

On another note, is there any kind of documentation about EVE, be it the overhaul or the regular version? I would love to know more about it, but have no idea where to start...

I have yet to verify it works with the new version, but I was able to put clouds on the Sun in the original EVE. To make them not appear black, you just have to give them very high RGB values (higher than one, e.g. 24) - due to the way Unity interprets colors, this will cause the clouds to render with bright colors even when not illuminated, or backlit as is the case on the Sun.

I found a nice sun-like orange was afforded by R=64, G=48, and B=32.

EDIT: I have now confirmed this does not appear to work in the Overhaul version, which makes me sad. If possible I think it'd be nice if rbray could add a little "glow" factor that assigns an emission / self-illumination value for cloud layers so we could also have cool lightning layers on Jool, bioluminescent clouds on Laythe, etc.

Edited January 20, 2015 by parameciumkid

I found a nice sun-like orange was afforded by R=64, G=48, and B=32..

you know the real sun is white, do you?

I have some bug or issue I don't know why its there. I have it in old and in Overhaul Eve. Anytime I place clouds (the 2D ones, not volumetric) on my upscaled Pol they appear way above the planet:

WHY?!?!?

How does EVE handle RSS upscales, do I have to write something specifically different into altitude od the clouds?

EDIT: Tracked it down on being a general issue with former small bodies. Bop and Gilly have the same issues. Is there any way to apply cloud effects to those bodies? My Pol has a radius of 1700km now, its properly big and it has an atmosphere. I would like to be able to apply clouds to it

Edited February 1, 2015 by SkyRex94
Looks like you've got an incredibly dense planetoid there with a really stinking huge atmospheric layer.
Yes, the Sun is white, but, well, in false-color pictures it's popular to make it a fiery orange. It's also popular to make it lime green, too, but that seems a bit too silly for me xD

you know the real sun is white, do you?

But.. The sun is green....
Hope you are ok rbray, wherever you are

But.. The sun is green....

Most of the Sunlight is green, that is right.

But if you look at it with your eye ( not recommended) or a camera, while you are in space, it appears white to us. And how something appears to our eyes defines the color of it.
